description: United States National CAD Standard (NCS) callout detection prompts

detail.name: Detail Callout
detail.text_prompt: A detail indicator symbol per NCS 01 42 00-020. Can be either a dashed circle OR dashed rectangle outline with 6mm (1/4 inch) continuous or medium dash line. Contains a detail identifier (number, letter, or alphanumeric) above a horizontal dividing line, with optional sheet reference below. Format examples: 'D2/A-512', '3/S5.1', 'A1/A-201'. The symbol is clean and distinct with NO triangles or solid attachments. Text is centered and uses construction drawing font. Sheet references include discipline prefix (A=Architectural, S=Structural, M=Mechanical, E=Electrical, P=Plumbing, C=Civil, L=Landscape) followed by sheet number with dash or dot separator (A-201, S5.1, S-501). Circle/rectangle size typically 0.3-0.8 inches. Based on US NCS standard 01 42 00-020.
visual_characteristics: Dashed circular OR dashed rectangular outline (6mm/1/4 inch line)
No triangles or solid attachments
Detail identifier above horizontal dividing line
Optional sheet reference below (A-201, S5.1, M-301 format)
Medium dash or continuous line outline
Sheet reference format: discipline letter + dash/dot + number
false_positives_to_exclude: Circles with only words (3+ consecutive letters)
Text like NORTH, SCALE, NOTE, DETAIL, VERIFY

elevation.name: Elevation Callout
elevation.text_prompt: An elevation indicator symbol per NCS 01 42 00-027/028/029. Consists of a solid circle (12.7mm or 1/2 inch diameter for exterior, 9.5mm or 3/8 inch for interior) with a solid black triangle marker attached to indicate viewing direction. Circle has thin black outline with white fill, divided horizontally by a line. Contains an elevation identifier (number, letter, or alphanumeric like 'A4', 'A1', '2') above the dividing line, with sheet reference below in format 'A4/A-201' or 'A1/A-201'. The triangle points in the direction from which the elevation is viewed. Can show single or multiple elevation markers. Based on US NCS standard 01 42 00-027 (exterior), 01 42 00-028/029 (interior). Sheet references use NCS format: discipline prefix + dash/dot + number (A-201, S5.1).
visual_characteristics: Solid circular outline (12.7mm/1/2 inch or 9.5mm/3/8 inch diameter)
Horizontal dividing line inside circle
Triangle marker attached to circle edge
Triangle indicates viewing direction
Elevation identifier above line (A4, A1, 2, etc.)
Sheet reference below line (A-201, S5.1 format)
false_positives_to_exclude: Section indicators with cutting plane lines

section.name: Section Callout
section.text_prompt: A section indicator symbol per NCS 01 42 00-077/078. Consists of a solid circle (12.7mm or 1/2 inch diameter) attached to a cutting plane line (break line showing where the section cut occurs). Circle has thin black outline, white fill, and horizontal dividing line. Contains a section identifier (letter or alphanumeric like 'B3', 'A2') above the line, with sheet reference below in format 'B3/A-303' or 'A2/S-401'. The circle is positioned at the end of the cutting plane line and shows the direction from which to view the section. The cutting plane line itself is a break line that cuts through the building/object. Based on US NCS standard 01 42 00-077/078. Sheet references follow NCS discipline+number format (A-303, S-401, etc.).
visual_characteristics: Solid circular outline (12.7mm/1/2 inch diameter)
Horizontal dividing line inside circle
Attached to cutting plane line (break line with section cut)
Section identifier above line (B3, A2, etc.)
Sheet reference below line (A-303, S-401 format)
Circle shows viewing direction for the section
Based on NCS 01 42 00-077/078
false_positives_to_exclude: Plain detail circles without cutting plane lines

title.name: Title Callout
title.text_prompt: A small circular callout symbol appearing at the bottom or corner of an enlarged detail drawing box. Circle has thin black outline with white fill, contains a reference number (1-99), letter (A-Z), or letter+number (A1, B2) that corresponds to a detail callout elsewhere on the sheet. Often accompanied by text labels such as detail name, scale information (SCALE: 1/4"=1'-0"), or drawing title. Positioned within or immediately below detail drawing boundary boxes rather than on the main plan view. Circle diameter typically 0.25-0.5 inches, slightly smaller than detail callouts on main plan.
visual_characteristics: Small circular outline
Located at bottom/corner of detail drawing boxes
Contains reference number or letter matching detail callout
Usually near text labels (detail name, scale)
Smaller than typical plan callouts (0.25-0.5 inches)
false_positives_to_exclude: Detail callouts on main plan view

exclude_rules: Any circle containing only words with 3+ consecutive letters
Circles with dimension text (measurements with fractions or units like 2-1/2", 16'-0")
Grid reference markers (single letters along grid lines)
Circles without clear geometric precision (freehand drawn)
